HTabControl

HTabControl is the main component of the HTabBar / HTabLabel / HTabControl / HTabView collection.  HTabControl is, in other words the controlling part of the tab compound component.  HTabControl is a control unit that allows multiple pages of information to be placed in one position.  Above the tabcontrol, there is a row of tabs where the user may select the page to be displayed.  Tab’s pages are called tab items.  A tabcontrol component can contain a lot of different GUI components.  TabControl view or theme can be changed; the helmiTheme is used by default.

Use HTabControl whenever you need to implement a client-side tabbing interface.

Summary
HTabControl
HTabControl is the main component of the HTabBar / HTabLabel / HTabControl / HTabView collection.
Instance variables

Constructs a new HTabControl and initializes subcomponents.
draw
Performs tab initialization phase 2.
addTab
Makes a new tab.
removeTab
Removes a tab and the view that it holds.
removeSelectedTab
Removes the tab and its content that is currently selected.
selectNextTab
Selects the next tab.
selectPreviousTab
Selects the previous tab.
selectTab
Selects (brings to ‘front’ / ‘shows’ / ‘activates’) the selected tab id and hides the previously active tab.
numberOfTabs
The number of tabs currently on this tab control.

Instance variables

type’[HTabControl]’
tabsA Hash of tabs.  The key is the tab id and the value is the HView with all the component contents of the tab.
labelViewsA HTabBar instance
activeTabThe tab id of the currently selected tab.

Extends

HControl

See Also

HTabBar HTabLabel HTabView HView

NOTE

HTab -components are still evolving.

constructor

constructor: function(_rect,
_parentClass,
_options)

Constructs a new HTabControl and initializes subcomponents.  HTabControl.draw performs initialization phase2, the component is not fully functional before that.

Parameters

_rectThe rectangle of the component.  See HView.constructor.
_parentClassThe parent component of the component.  See HView.constructor.
_options(Object, optional)

_options attributes

labelThe default label for new tabs (default: ‘Untitled’)
labelHeightThe default height (in px) for new tabs (default: 21)
labelWidthThe default width (in px) for new tabs (default: 192)

draw

draw: function()

Performs tab initialization phase 2.  Initializes structures and subcomponents.  Does nothing except what <HControl.draw> does after the first time called.

See also

constructor <HControl.draw>

addTab

addTab: function(_tabView,
_selectOnCreation,
_label,
_labelWidth)

Makes a new tab.  Parameters are optional, not supported and will change in a later revision.

Parameters

_tabView(optional) A HView or HControl -compatible object to attach to the tab.  Default to create a new HTabView with defaults defined in the constructor.
_selectOnCreation(optional) Selects the tab (brings it to ‘front’) after it’s created.
_label(optional) The label to assign to the new tab.
_labelWidth(optional) The width of the tab label component.

Returns

The tab id, use it to refer to tabs.

removeTab

removeTab: function(_tabId)

Removes a tab and the view that it holds.  If a selected tab is removed, the selection is moved to the previous tab (or to the next tab if the deleted tab is the first one).

Parameters

_tabIdThe ID of the tab to be removed.

removeSelectedTab

removeSelectedTab: function()

Removes the tab and its content that is currently selected.

selectNextTab

selectNextTab: function()

Selects the next tab.

Returns

True if there was a next tab, and the selected tab changed, false if the currently selected tab is the last one, and selection didn’t change.

selectPreviousTab

selectPreviousTab: function()

Selects the previous tab.

Returns

True if there was a previous tab, and the selected tab changed, false if the currently selected tab is the first one, and selection didn’t change.

selectTab

selectTab: function(_tabId)

Selects (brings to ‘front’ / ‘shows’ / ‘activates’) the selected tab id and hides the previously active tab.

Parameters

_tabIdA valid tab id.

Returns

True if the active tab was changed, false if the given tab id was invalid or the same as the currently active tab.

numberOfTabs

numberOfTabs: function()

Returns

The number of tabs currently on this tab control.
Generated by Natural Docs
HTabBar has no logic functionality at all.
HTabLabel displays the ‘tab title button’ above the tab view.
HTabControl is the main component of the HTabBar / HTabLabel / HTabControl / HTabView collection.
HTabBar has no logic functionality at all.
